diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Isolated 17,20-lyase deficiency due to the Cytochrome b5 Mutation W27X
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the identification of a homozygous W27X mutation in the CYB5 gene, leading to a premature stop codon that resulted in deficient 17,20-lyase activity. Hormone analysis showed inconsistent testosterone levels after hCG stimulation, and elevated LH levels indicated a deficiency in androgen production, consistent with isolated 17,20-lyase deficiency.
